div.p: Habiba is the grandmother and the tree, a fruit-bearing olive tree, an aged nature. An accumulation of experiences. Yes, we are beyond just a kitchen.
The  branches in the trees represent the various cuisines, cultures that we are inspired by.
We are fascinated by this diversity of cooking methods, ingredients, styles, and stories.

Habiba Kitchen is born grateful to nature and people, giving us a great opportunity to build bridges and conversations between communities,  together celebrating diversity, simplicity, and openness through shared food, space, feelings, sense, intention and purpose.

Habiba Kitchen is a hybrid concept. Our aim is to be independent, creative, and experimental with no attachment to a single country food/cuisine, product, cooking method, or diet. We exist to highlight foods with stories, we live or wish to live and celebrate with our customers.

Our logo is an olive tree, a  fruitful tree through whose fruits we like to tell our story and values. The oliveâ€™s life is a journey we identified in 6: a sprout, a white flower, a green olive, green-purple mix, a purple olive, and a black olive
It is the intention to do and be. Whether it is cooking, sharing food, space, or purpose. It all starts with intention. Being grateful is our starting prayer.
We practice simplicity and contentment throughout our intentions and outcomes. Free of pretence, easy and meaningful
We do our part to the best we can to make sure our footprints live in harmony with nature.
Our aim is to bring foods together, building bridges between different cultures as much as bringing people together, setting up a table for a great gathering.
The truth is relative. Being open diversifies choices and experience and brings value to our customers. It is our joy to explore and invite you to be on such a journey with us.
all the colors, shapes and forms of the olive come together in one. And so our end goal  and purpose:  Community
